intro: [WRONG START] S-tevia angustifolia var. integrifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stevia, is a perennial herb native to South America. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is noted for its high concentration of steviol glycosides, which are natural sweeteners. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant in both traditional medicine and modern herbal applications.
